meanings.definition: To become solid or firm, typically through cooling or chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The jelly gelled in the fridge overnight.
meanings.sent2: The pudding gelled nicely after being left to cool.
meanings.sent3: The plan finally gelled together at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas gelled into a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The mixture gelled into a perfect consistency.

meanings.definition: To come together as a cohesive whole.
meanings.sent1: The team gelled quickly and worked efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The band gelled during their first performance together.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients gelled perfectly in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship gelled over shared interests.
meanings.sent5: The colors gelled together beautifully in the painting.

meanings.definition: To cause to become solid or firm.
meanings.sent1: She gelled the ingredients by adding gelatin.
meanings.sent2: The chef gelled the sauce by chilling it.
meanings.sent3: His instructions gelled the team into a cohesive unit.
meanings.sent4: The architect gelled the design with innovative elements.
meanings.sent5: The cooling process gelled the liquid into a solid form.
